TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant is a farmer and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested permissions under LAW ( Wasserrechtsgesetz ) and LAW ( Landschaftsschutzgesetz ) which were necessary for putting a culvert through a drain on agricultural land owned by him .
CARDINAL . Thereupon , on DATE ORG Bezirkshauptmannschaft ) conducted an oral hearing on the applicant ’s requests and inspected his land .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused the requested permissions . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Governor ( PERSON ) granted the requested permission under LAW .
CARDINAL . ORG ( PERSON ) , on DATE , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal insofar as it concerned the request for permission under LAW .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG ( Verwaltungsgerichtshof ) against ORG decision .

CARDINAL . ORG quashed ORG decision on the ground of procedural deficiencies on DATE and remitted the case to the latter . It found that the authorities had failed to obtain detailed information concerning nature conservancy issues which were raised by the applicant ’s project .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG invited the applicant to comment on the additional expert opinion on nature conservancy issues of the expert A. On DATE the applicant submitted his comments , following which ORG amended the expert opinion on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on CARDINAL DATE , the applicant lodged an application with ORG against the administrative authorities’ failure to decide ( PERSON ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG to issue a decision within DATE . Subsequently , ORG appointed an expert on agriculture and forestry issues , who , after inspecting the applicant ’s land on DATE , delivered his opinion on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested ORG to order expert A. to submit an additional expert opinion on nature conservancy issues , which ORG delivered on DATE .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on DATE , ORG invited the applicant to submit comments on the expert opinions on nature conservancy issues and on agriculture and forestry issues within DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant submitted comments on these opinions and requested an oral hearing . He also requested that the experts be summoned to the hearing and that the land be inspected by the court . He stressed that the project would improve the productivity of the agricultural land and that therefore public interest existed in the realisation of his project as required under the applicable law . He also challenged the expert A. for bias as he had already delivered an opinion upon a request by ORG and that his independence was doubtful as he was a civil servant bound by instructions .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning the request for permission under LAW . It found that the competence to decide on the merits had passed over to it as ORG had failed to decide within the DATE time - limit set .

CARDINAL . Further it found , in view of the expert opinions , that the applicant ’s project interfered with the objects of LAW as it would spoil the character of the landscape and that there existed no public interest which would justify the measure . Moreover , the applicant had not disproved the expert ’s conclusion .

CARDINAL . As regards the alleged bias of ORG , it found that the mere fact that the expert had already delivered an opinion at an earlier stage of the proceedings and that he was a civil servant was not in itself sufficient to raise doubts as to his independence and impartiality and that the applicant had failed to put forward any specific argument to cast doubt upon ORG ’s independence or impartiality .

CARDINAL . Finally , the court held that it could abstain from an oral hearing and an inspection of the applicant ’s land since the proceedings had been carried out correctly and the facts , insofar as relevant in view of the applicable law , were undisputed . This decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on CARDINAL DATE .
